content.description:
Kapoopsie is a quality line whose only drawback is that it's short.

Start on the right side of the alcove in the middle of the alcove and climb the crack feature that trends up and right. Where the crack ends climb up the face, encountering the crux at the fourth and final bolt. Staying right, and on the face proper, at the fourth bolt is a little harder but cleaner and better. You can also step left into a large crack for an easier, but dirtier finish.

This is probably the best warmup in the area for those looking for a 5.10 start to their climbing session.
content.location: In the middle of the Gecko Wall is a small alcove. Kapoopsie starts on the right side of this alcove, climbing the crack feature that trends up and right.

content.description: Climb excellent rock in the large white streak on right-angling rails past two bolts to the roof. Hard moves are encountered going through the roof before finishing on a thought provoking slab protected by two bolts before the anchor.
content.location: The leftmost route on the Gecko Wall, in the middle of a large white streak.

climbs.name: Gecko
climbs.fa: Jeff Achey, Scott Norris, Janet Smith, 2007

content.description:
Gecko is another great route on high quality rock but a short length.

Moderate climbing on large, incut holds leads to the difficult, crimper crux at the second bolt. Above the crux, sustained climbing is found on sharp holds to the anchor.
content.location: On the right side of the Gecko Wall, this climb ascends the steep face behind the juniper.

content.description:
Climb the steep crack system coming out of the alcove for two bolts before reaching the roof and a good rest on the right-angling ramp system that leads to

Kapoopsie's

anchors. Reach left from the ramp to navigate the crux moves through the roof on beautiful orange rock. Above the crux you can move slightly right to a welcome jug before moving up and left on a hand rail past a fixed pin to reach the anchor.
content.protection: 6 bolts and 1 fixed pin plus the anchor.
content.location:
On the left side of the Gecko Wall, starting in the alcove at the base of the wall, in between

Jhoon Bee

and

Kapoopsie

. Some distinctive, beautiful, gray water streaks also mark the bottom of this route.
